skill.name: Git Workflow Skill
skill.description: Git workflow management including branch validation, commit conventions, PR preparation, and repository health checks.
skill.summary: Git workflow management including branch validation, commit conventions, PR preparation, and reposit...
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, file access beyond its directory, network calls, or environment variable access. This is documentation-only guidance for git workflows.

content.value_statement: Git workflows can be inconsistent without clear conventions. This skill enforces branch naming, commit message standards, and PR preparation for team collaboration.
actual_capabilities: Validates branch names against naming conventions
Provides semantic release mapping for commits
limitations: Does not execute git commands directly
Does not access or modify repository files
Requires user to run git commands manually
Does not integrate with git hosting platforms

use_cases.title: Enforce commit standards
use_cases.description: Create consistent commit messages following conventional commits format across your team

use_cases.title: Validate branch naming
use_cases.description: Ensure branches follow naming conventions like feat/, fix/, docs/ before merging

use_cases.title: Prepare PR descriptions
use_cases.description: Generate standardized pull request descriptions with checklists for contributors

prompt_templates.title: Create feature branch
prompt_templates.scenario: Need to create a new feature branch
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a feature branch for adding user authentication. Show me the git commands following the branch naming conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Write commit message
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write a conventional commit message for fixing a bug in the login validation logic.

prompt_templates.title: Prepare PR
prompt_templates.scenario: Feature complete and ready for review
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a pull request description for my authentication feature branch that includes a summary of changes and test checklist.

prompt_templates.title: Check repository health
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the repository status and validate that all branches follow the naming conventions.

output_examples.input: Prepare a commit message for adding dark mode toggle to settings

best_practices: Use descriptive branch names that explain the change purpose
Follow conventional commit format for automated versioning
Always validate branch naming before creating pull requests
anti_patterns: Using vague branch names like 'fix' or 'update' without context
Skipping the commit type prefix (feat:, fix:, docs:)
Creating pull requests without description templates or checklists

faq.question: What git commands does this skill execute?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance and examples. Users must run git commands manually.

faq.question: Does this skill work with GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides universal git workflow guidance that applies to any git hosting platform.

faq.question: What branch naming formats are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports feat/, fix/, docs/, refactor/, perf/, test/, chore/, and hotfix/ prefixes with descriptive slugs.

faq.question: Is my repository data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill is read-only documentation. It does not access or modify your repository files.

faq.question: Can I customize the commit conventions?
faq.answer: The skill follows conventional commits. You can adapt the templates provided for your team's specific needs.

faq.question: How does this differ from git CLI?
faq.answer: The git CLI executes commands. This skill provides intelligent guidance for workflow decisions and conventions.
